results.title: Child's play
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Developing child”.
With the ability to walk, the child reaches a major milestone along the road to adulthood. One day they will leave their family’s care and face the world alone. The toddler asserts their new sense of independence. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: From birth to walking
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Developing child”.
During the first months of his life the child gradually discovers the world of sensory experience that surrounds him. “From birth to walking” aims to encourage parents to become more involved with their young children by providing an interesting and stimulating environment and a loving relationship. This film is the second in a four part series.

results.title: Towards school
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Developing child”
Preschool is, for the child, the gateway between the familiarity of home, and the formal education system. Shows children at play, developing and practising new skills.

results.title: Pregnancy and birth
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Developing child”.
Derek Llewellyn-Jones, Professor of Obstetrics, University of Sydney, stresses the importance of prenatal care, child birth education and psychoprophylaxis in promoting relaxation and confidence during the birth process. An actual birth is shown.

results.title: The Seventh mandarin
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
Long ago in a walled palace lived a Chiense emperor, guarded and guided by seven assistants called mandarins. None of them ever set foot outside the palace and they knew nothing of the people until the seventh and youngest mandarin ventured out one night…Based on the picture book by Jane Yolen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions

results.title: The World's greatest freak show
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
A cartoon adventure designed to develop reading skills by visualising book materials. Presents the story of a man who in his efforts to obtain riches, exploits freaks for theatrical purposes. Based on the picture book by Ellen Raskin. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: The Peasant's pea patch: a Russian folk tale
results.creator_credit: Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
This tall tale from Russian folklore follows the hilarious misadventures of a Russian peasant who tries in vain to protect his pea patch from a flock of hungry cranes. The film ends with the defeated peasant illustrating that, although life can be difficult, humanity somehow manages not only to survive but to survive in good spirit.
